column3: Michelle Kim Maykin (Thai: มิเชล เมฆินทร์
column6: 2009) was a well-known figure in the Asian American community who promoted ethnic participation in the national marrow registry
column7: the National Marrow Donor Program. Suffering from acute myeloid leukemia herself
column8: she began a personal search for a bone marrow donor and began the internationally noted campaign
column10: which was able to register more than 18
column11: 000 people as well as find matches for 4 different patients. Unable to find a match herself
